physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Height and weight below the 25th percentile. Scattered cafe au lait spots on the perineum, trunk, and extremities. Enlarged penis. Fixed ovoid firm mass involving the prostate, seminal vesicles, and bladder. Mild scoliosis of the lumbar spine. Urinalysis showing 10 to 12 red and 8 to 10 white blood cells per high power field. Excretory urogram revealed left hydronephrosis and deviation of the left lower ureter. Cystogram demonstrated irregular contour of the bladder with some elevation of the bladder base. Cystoscopy revealed pale bladder mucosa with evidence of extrinsic compression.
Moderate lateral fixation of the mass involving the seminal vesicles and prostate, surrounding the bladder and compromising the lower third of the left ureter.
Asymptomatic with normal blood urea nitrogen and creatinine.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement in upper tracts, no recurrent disease.
